Member Function Documentation

bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::evaluateSpline ( const unsigned int  span,
const float  t,
Vector &  result 
) const

evaluateSpline:

If the daemon is of Spline type, returns the point of the spline given by the span and the parameter t.

Parameters:
[in]span/ The section of the spline to be evaluated. Must be less than the number of control points of the spline.
[in]t/ Parameter between 0 and 1 to determine where the spline is evaluated.
[out]result/ The position of the spline for the given parameters.
Returns:
: False if the span is out of range or this is not a spline daemon.
bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::getControlPointAllParameterNames ( std::vector< std::pair< std::string, int > > &  parameterNames) const

getControlPointAllParameterNames:

Gets a list of Tuples < Parameter name, Parameter type >

  • Parameter names and types existing for the control point
Parameters:
[out]parameterNames/ Vector of Tuples < Parameter name, Parameter type >
Returns:
: False if the type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
std::string nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::getControlPointCurveName ( const int  pointIndex,
const std::string  parameterName 
) const

getControlPointCurveName:

Deprecated, now is possible to access the curve of a control point using the control point index.

template<class T >
const T nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::getControlPointParameter ( const unsigned int  index,
const std::string &  name,
bool &  ok 
) const

getControlPointParameter:

Get the control point value for the parameter. Please read "setControlPointParameter" description to know more about this function.

Parameters:
[in]index/ The index of the control point.
[in]name/ The control point parameter name.
[out]ok/ False if the parameter can't be changed, reasons could be:
  • The index of the control point is not valid.
  • The type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
  • The parameter does not exist.
  • The parameter type is not the right one.
Returns:
: The control point parameter's value.
Curve nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::getControlPointParameterCurve ( const unsigned int  index,
const std::string &  name,
bool &  ok 
) const

getControlPointParameterCurve:

Parameters:
[in]index/ The index of the control point.
[in]name/ The control point parameter name.
[out]ok/ False if the parameter can't be changed, reasons could be:
  • The index of the control point is not valid.
  • The type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
  • The parameter does not exist.
Returns:
: The control point parameter's curve
sdk_type::SdkParamType nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::getControlPointParameterType ( const std::string &  name,
bool &  ok 
) const

getControlPointParameterType:

Get the control point parameter's type.

Parameters:
[in]name/ Control point parameter's name.
[out]ok/ False if the parameter can't be changed, reasons could be:
  • The type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
  • The parameter does not exist.
Returns:
: The parameter type, values in Param_Type [ TYPE_FLOAT TYPE_DOUBLE TYPE_LIST TYPE_INT TYPE_BOOL TYPE_EDIT TYPE_CBUTTON TYPE_BUTTON TYPE_BROWSE TYPE_VECTOR TYPE_COLOR ]
std::string nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::getDaemonType ( void  ) const

getDaemonType: Returns the name of the type of the daemon. For example: "Gravity"..

Returns:
:The type of the daemon as a string
int nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::getNumberOfControlPoints ( void  )

getNumberOfControlPoints: Returns the number of control points of the DSpline daemon.

Returns:
:The number of control points. 0 if daemon is not of DSpline type.

bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::insertControlPoint ( const Vector &  position,
const Vector &  handleInPosition,
const Vector &  handleOutPosition 
)

insertControlPoint: Inserts a new control point for the DSpline daemon.

Parameters:
[in]position/ The position of the control point.
[in]handleInPosition/ The position of the in handle of the control point.
[in]handleOutPosition/ The position of the out handle of the control point.
Returns:
: False if the type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::removeAllControlPoints ( void  )

removeAllControlPoints: Removes all the DSpline daemon control points.

Returns:
: False if the type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::removeControlPoint ( const unsigned int  index)

removeControlPoint: Removes the current control point for the DSpline daemon.

Parameters:
[in]index/ The index of the control point.
Returns:
: False if the index of the control point is not valid or if the type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::removeControlPoints ( void  )

removeControlPoints: Deprecated, use removeAllControlPoints instead.

Returns:
: False if the type of the daemon is not the GSpline.

)

bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::setControlPointParameter ( const unsigned int  index,
const std::string &  name,
const float &  value 
)

setControlPointParameter: Set value for the parameter of a control point. The parameter name is the one that can be seen in the user interface. It is not case sensitive. The value can be any type that is accepted for the parameters in the user interface. Care must be taken when using this function about the type of the values and the parameter names, a hard type and name check is done reporting the corresponding errors to the user in any case

Parameters:
[in]index/ The index of the control point.
[in]name/ The control point parameter name.
[in]value/ The control point parameter value.
Returns:
: False if the parameter can't be changed, reasons could be:
  • The index of the control point is not valid.
  • The type of the daemon is not the GSpline.
  • The parameter does not exist.
  • The parameter type is not the right one.
bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::setControlPointParameter ( const unsigned int  index,
const std::string &  name,
const double &  value 
)

bool nextlimit::rf_sdk::Daemon::setEditionMode ( const bool  enableEdition)

setEditionMode: Changes the state of the DSpline edition mode. It is the same effect as when clicking on the "Edit" button.

Parameters:
[in]enableEdition/ True to activate edition mode.
Returns:
:True if the daemon is a DSpline. False otherwise.
